member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Indicates if the control is currently in design mode

member.summary: Binds data of the specified controls into the specified BindingSource

member.returns: True if the databinding operation succeeded otherwise false

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.Unbind
member.summary: Unbind the controls back into their underlying binding sources. Returns true on success false on failure. On failure the BindingErrors collection will be set
member.returns: True if there are no errors. False if unbinding failed. Check the BindingErrors for errors.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.Unbind(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Unbind the controls back into their binding source. Returns true on success false on failure. On failure the BindingErrors collection will be set
member.param: The top level container Control that is bound.
member.returns: True if there are no errors. False if unbinding failed. Check the BindingErrors for errors.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.AddBinding(System.Web.UI.Control,System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary:
Adds a binding to the control. This method is a simple way to establish a binding.
Returns the Item so you can customize properties further
member.param: The control which is to be bound on the WebForm
The property on the control which is to be bound by the DataBinder
The object which is to be bound from your model or code behind file
The property on the object which is to be bound by the DataBinder
member.returns: An EntityDataBindingItem instance which describes the binding between WebForm control and source object

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.AddBinding(System.Web.UI.Control,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Adds a binding to the control. This method is a simple way to establish a binding.
Returns the Item so you can customize properties further
member.param: The control which is to be bound on the WebForm
The property on the control which is to be bound by the DataBinder
The object which is to be bound from your model or code behind file
The property on the object which is to be bound by the DataBinder
member.returns: An EntityDataBindingItem instance which describes the binding between WebForm control and source object

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.AddBinding(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: This method only adds a data binding item, but doesn't bind it to anything. This can be useful for only displaying errors
member.param: The control which is to be bound on the WebForm
member.returns: An EntityDataBindingItem which describes the binding to a control on a WebForm

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.LoadFromControls(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Picks up all controls on the form that implement the IWebDataBinder interface and adds them to the DataBindingItems Collection
member.param: The container which contains the controls which are to be inspected

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.LoadDataBoundControls(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Loop through all of the contained controls of the form and check for all that implement IWebDataBinder. If found add the BindingItem to this Databinder
member.param: The container which contains the controls which are to be inspected

member.summary: Fires the ValidateControlEvent

member.returns: false - Validation for control failed and a BindingError is added, true - Validation succeeded

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.CanExtend(System.Object)
member.summary: Specifies whether this object can provide its extender properties to the specified object.
member.param: The to receive the extender properties.
member.returns: true if this object can provide extender properties to the specified object; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.GetDataBindingItem(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary:
Returns a specific DataBinding Item for a given control. Always returns an item even if the Control is not found. If you need to check whether this is a valid item check the BindingSource property for being blank.
Extender Property Get method
member.param: The control which we wish to return an EntityDataBindingItem for
member.returns: The EntityDataBindingItem which is related to the control, this will be returned from BindingItems if an entry already exists

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.GetDataBindingItem(System.String)
member.summary: Return a specific databinding item for a give control id. Note unlike the ControlInstance version return null if the ControlId isn't found.
member.param: The control identifier which we wish to return an EntityDataBindingItem for
member.returns: The EntityDataBindingItem which is related to the control or null if no matching item is found

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.NotifyDesigner
member.summary: this method is used to ensure that designer is notified every time there is a change in the sub-ordinate validators

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.BindingItems
member.summary: Gets the binding items.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.AutoLoadDataBoundControls
member.summary: Automatically imports all controls on the form that implement the IWebDataBinder interface and adds them to the DataBinder
member.value: true if [auto load data bound controls]; otherwise, false.

member.name: E:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.ValidateControl
member.summary:
Event that can be hooked to validate each control after it's been unbound. Allows for doing application level validation of the data once it's been returned.
This method receives a WebDataBindingItem parameter which includes a reference to both the control and the DataSource object where you can check values. Return false from the event method to indicate that validation failed which causes a new BindingError to be created and added to the BindingErrors collection.

member.name: E:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.BeforeBindControl
member.summary: Fired just before the control is bound. You can return false from the handler to cause the control to not be bound

member.name: E:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.AfterBindControl
member.summary: Fires immediately after the control has been bound. You can check for errors or perform additional validation.

member.name: E:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.BeforeUnbindControl
member.summary: Fires immediately before unbinding of a control takes place. You can return false to abort DataUnbinding

member.name: E:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBinder.AfterUnbindControl
member.summary: Fires immediately after binding is complete. You can check for errors and take additional action.

member.summary: Delegate for events raised relating to entity data binding items

member.summary: Delegate for events raised relating to entity data binding items
member.param: The data binding item involved

member.summary: Enumeration which specifies how binding should be handled for a given

member.name: F:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.BindingMode.TwoWay
member.summary: Databinding occurs for DataBind() and Unbind()

member.name: F:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.BindingMode.OneWay
member.summary: DataBinding occurs for DataBind() only

member.name: F:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.BindingMode.None
member.summary: No binding occurs

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem
member.summary: An individual data binding item that allows you to bind a source binding source - a database field or Object property typically - to a target control property

member.summary: Indicates if the control is in design mode

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The parent.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.OnValidate
member.summary: Fires the Validation Event
member.returns: true if the item was successfully validated otherwise false

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.DataBind
member.summary: Binds a source object and property to a control's property. For example you can bind a business object to a the text property of a text box, or a DataRow field to a text box field. You specify a binding source object (Customer.Entity or Customer.DataRow) and property or field(Company, FirstName) and bind it to the control and the property specified (Text).

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.DataBind(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Binds a source object and property to a control's property. For example you can bind a business object to a the text property of a text box, or a DataRow field to a text box field. You specify a binding source object (Customer.Entity or Customer.DataRow) and property or field(Company, FirstName) and bind it to the control and the property specified (Text).
member.param: the Base control that binding source objects are attached to

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.Unbind
member.summary:
Unbinds control properties back into the control source.
This method uses reflection to lift the data out of the control, then parses the string value back into the type of the data source. If an error occurs the exception is not caught internally, but generally the FormUnbindData method captures the error and assigns an error message to the BindingErrorMessage property of the control.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.Unbind(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Unbinds the specified web page.
member.param: The web page.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.ToString
member.summary: Returns a path description for the controls binding source and binding source member
member.returns: A path description in the syntax of Source.Member

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.Binder
member.summary: Gets or sets the associated

member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the control to that is bound

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.DisplayFormat
member.summary: Format Expression ( {0:c) ) applied to the binding source when it's displayed. Watch out for two way conversion issues when formatting this way. If you create expressions and you are also saving make sure the format used can be saved back.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.IsRequired
member.summary: If set requires that the control contains a value, otherwise a validation error is thrown Useful mostly on TextBox controls only.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.FriendlyName
member.summary: A descriptive name for the field used for error display

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.BindingMode
member.summary: Determines how databinding and unbinding is done on the target control. One way only fires DataBind() and ignores Unbind() calls. Two-way does both. None effectively turns off binding.

member.name: E:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.Validate
member.summary: Use this event to hook up special validation logic. Called after binding completes. Return false to indicate validation failed

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the programmatic identifier assigned to the server control.
member.returns: The programmatic identifier assigned to the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a server control is rendered as UI on the page.
member.returns: true if the control is visible on the page; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.WebForms.EntityDataBindingItem.EnableViewState
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the server control persists its view state, and the view state of any child controls it contains, to the requesting client.
member.returns: true if the server control maintains its view state; otherwise false. The default is true.

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Mvc.LightSpeedControllerBase`1
member.summary: Provides a base implementation of an ASP.NET MVC controller which provides a LightSpeed UnitOfWork instance through the PerRequestUnitOfWorkScope.
member.remarks: By default this controller will dispose of the UnitOfWork instance as part of the ResultExecuted event, if you do not want this behavior then disable DisposeUnitOfWorkOnResultExecuted and provide a manual implementation for disposal as required.
member.typeparam: The type of the IUnitOfWork held by this controller.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Mvc.LightSpeedControllerBase`1.OnResultExecuted(System.Web.Mvc.ResultExecutedContext)
member.summary: Called after the action result that is returned by an action method is executed.
member.param: Information about the current request and action result

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Mvc.LightSpeedControllerBase`1.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases all resources that are used by the current instance of the class.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Mvc.LightSpeedControllerBase`1.LightSpeedContext
member.summary: Returns an instance of the LightSpeedContext object which will be used to create any UnitOfWork instances used by this controller

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Mvc.LightSpeedControllerBase`1.UnitOfWork
member.summary: Returns the current UnitOfWork instance which is being held

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Mvc.LightSpeedControllerBase`1.DisposeUnitOfWorkOnResultExecuted
member.summary: Indicates if the controller should handle disposal of the UnitOfWork instance as part of the ResultExecuted handler. By default this is enabled.

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.EnsureSecureConstraint
member.summary: Routing constraint which forces a route to be requested under a secure connection and will redirect to a secure connection if otherwise requested

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.EnsureSecureConstraint.Match(System.Web.HttpContextBase,System.Web.Routing.Route,System.String,System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary,System.Web.Routing.RouteDirection)
member.summary: Determines whether the URL parameter contains a valid value for this constraint.
member.param: An object that encapsulates information about the HTTP request.
The object that this constraint belongs to.
The name of the parameter that is being checked.
An object that contains the parameters for the URL.
An object that indicates whether the constraint check is being performed when an incoming request is being handled or when a URL is being generated.
member.returns: true if the URL parameter contains a valid value; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.WebContractRouteBuilder
member.summary: Helper class which is used by the WebContractBuilder for generating routes

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.WebContractAttribute
member.summary: Declares that this class or interface specifies a contract to be bound for web request routing and that its operations should be inspected to build appropriate routes.
member.remarks: The RootPath property is used as the base for any routes build underneath this contract.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.WebContractAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.WebContractAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The root path used when building the routes.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.WebContractAttribute.RootPath
member.summary: Returns the URL format which has been specified against this instance.

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.GetAttribute
member.summary: Describes a GET based route to be applied to an action.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.GetAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.GetAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Name of the action.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.GetAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name which should be used to describe the action in terms of the route.
member.example: An action called Bar with the Name of Foo would cause a route called /foo to be built. If there is no name set then the route would be called /bar

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.GetAttribute.Secure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is secure.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: The name which should be used to describe the action in terms of the route.
member.example: An action called Bar with the Name of Foo would cause a route called /foo to be built. If there is no name set then the route would be called /bar

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.UrlStemAttribute
member.summary: Describes that a parameter for the action is to form part of the stem leading up to the action itself.

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.UrlStemSuffixAttribute
member.summary: Describes that a parameter for the action is to form part of the stem following the action itself.

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.OptionalUrlStemSuffixAttribute
member.summary: Describes that a parameter for the action is to form part of the stem following the action itself. This parameter can be optional which allows for a route where no parameter is supplied.
member.example: Given an action with the signature: ActionResult Bar(string foo); The default for this would be /bar If [UrlStemSuffix] is applied to the parameter foo then the resulting routes created would would be /bar and /bar/[foo]

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.DefaultValueAttribute
member.summary: Describes a default value which can be supplied to the parameter.

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.DefaultValueAttribute.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The value.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.DefaultValueAttribute.Value
member.summary: Gets the value.

member.name: T:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.WebContractBuilder
member.summary: Builds routing for any WebContract definitions which have been specified in a given assembly

member.name: M:Mindscape.LightSpeed.Web.Routing.WebContractBuilder.BuildFromAssembly(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Builds routing for any WebContract definitions which have been specified in the given assembly
member.param: The assembly which contains the WebContract definitions.
member.returns: true if the routing was successfully built else false
